website_summaries.verdict: A wireless keyboard that's easy to use without needing to stock up on batteries.
pros: Keys are backlit and the brightness can be adjusted
Rechargeable with included micro USB cable
You can get up to 10 days with one charge
cons: Keys are delicate and easy to break

website_summaries.verdict: Offers unbeatable comfort. Feels professional, sturdy, and advanced. Simply the best keyboard on the market right now.
pros: The "PerfectStroke" key system minimizes typos and provides comfort and nearly silent typing
The slick design is paired with a touch-activated backlight: simply waving a hand will turn it on
cons: Doesn't boast curves like other ergonomic models
Relatively short battery life, but there is an easy USB-powered recharging system

website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Wireless Illuminated Keyboard K800 is a worthwhile refresh with updates that include a Unifying receiver for consolidated USB port access, rechargeable AA NiMH batteries, and Logitech's comfortable PerfectStroke key design. If you do your typing in the dark, the adjustable backlit Wireless K800 won't disappoint.
pros: NiMH batteries recharge with Micro-USB cable
Unifying receiver connects multiple devices using single plug
PerfectStroke key system offers uniform tactile feedback
cons: Thin profile allows sacrifices design for durability

customer_reviews.title: It's not durable
customer_reviews.text: When I received it was perfect, the light sensor was awesome and everything but within 4 months 2 keys have poped out and now is useless. When I received it, it was awesome, the light sensor and the soft feeling...great. BUT within a couple of months a started feeling that the light started failing and little by little one key poped out, then another one. How is this possible for a keyboard of this price range?!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Keyboard but Hard to Clean
customer_reviews.text: My second K800. Used for software development. This is a good keyboard with a few problems I'm willing to live with in exchange for a wireless k/b with back-lighting. Cons: Hard to clean Key are VERY delicate - don't spill anything! If you have to remove a key, chances are good it will break. The attachment on the keyboard will also break so replacing keys isn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: motowrench

customer_reviews.title: Did not stand the test of time - I wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was great at the start, but in the past month has begun to have a delayed response sending data to my computer screen. I am typing this review from my laptop keyboard because even after fully charging the keyboard this morning, it appears to have lost a third of its charge after moments of use, and is not responsive! I am sorely disappointed because the support window closed 23 days ago. Not a good investment, not a reliable product. I'll contact Amazon to see if I have any recourse, but I'm not feeling hopeful :o( I'm doubly sad because I wanted this keyboard as a sustainable/rechargeable option. I'll need to look at other options now.
customer_reviews.author: Misha Lenz

customer_reviews.title: A really great keyboard for the money - but prone to failure
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. The backlighting works excellently and it is really one of most silent keyboards that I have used. I would have enjoyed some ergonomic features, but it is not really a major issue. I have found this a fast keyboard to type with and although I do not use the backlighting that much, I appreciated it being there. The only major issue is that it has to be charged from time to time, which is a bit of a bother. This is an update. The keyboard failed in about 6 months after purchase!!! Not an outstanding product. It works well when it does, but then it simply dies!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anastassios R.

customer_reviews.title: Complete Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Logitech keyboards for over a decade. I've probably purchased more than 100, particularly the 750 which, while it would occasionally have connection issues depending on the radio interference in your locality, this keyboard is worse than a piece of junk. While the battery life is pathetic, the worst thing is that the keyboard has a nasty habit of turning CAPS LOCK on and off at random. The keyboard is less than 36 inches from the wireless receiver. There is nothing else in my office that transmits wirelessly except the Logitech mouse. This keyboard is a disgrace. Don't waste your money. I only gave it 1 star because I couldn't give it none !
customer_reviews.author: robertolini

customer_reviews.title: It isn't keeping a charge.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this keyboard for very long, as it sat in my house for about a year or so un-used when I had to go to Iowa to take care of a family member, but now that I am using it constantly i'm finding it won't hold a very strong charge anymore, so I am rather disappointed that I can't use it anymore. For what I paid for it, I would expect it to last longer than it has. I needed the light-up keyboard because of my eyes, but this isn't staying on for long anymore, disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: sharon m.

customer_reviews.title: Illumination will NOT turn off
customer_reviews.text: I have had this less than a month and it will not work correctly. The illumination will NOT turn off. It is set to disabled and will not remain off. It also will intermittently start flashing. I have to keep manually turning down the brightness every time it turns on. I have had many Logitech products in the past (remotes, mice, other keyboards) and from what i have seen their products are great until you need help. I have sent numerous emails asking for support and possibly a replacement, since this appears to be a pretty common issue with this keyboard and they need to replace it. So far I have heard NOTHING from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: crashley

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted two months
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has a 30 day warranty. Mine lasted two months. I never dropped it, ate or drank near it, or spilled anything on or near it. One afternoon it started spouting gibberish when I tried to type. Some keys produce 3 or 4 characters, some none at all. The s key puts my computer into sleep mode. I tried restoring my settings from backup and then restoring defaults using the Logitech Options software, but it did nothing. Other than that, I was happy with it while it worked. I bought it to replace an old K520 that still works fine but that I have used so long that the letters are worn off of the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Neal A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this keyboard for the first six months. I am a developer and type all day long, so I prob put my keyboard through more than some other users. Having said that I came in this morning and the keyboard was typing odd characters and I had to replace just to sign in. (At first I thought my accounts were hacked until I took a breath and used a wired keyboard.) I followed all the "help" instructions, charged the keyboard, uninstalled, reinstalled, no luck. Will never buy a logitech keyboard again. Failed way to quickly.
customer_reviews.author: M. P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - falling apart after less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Update: I'm giving an additional star for Logitech customer service. I contacted them and they replaced my keyboard for free. I still wouldn't recommend this product because I shouldn't have had to go through the hassle after just a few months. However, props to them for sending out a new one. First review: Really disappointed in this keyboard. Only 9 months since I purchased it and the keys are already falling off. I might expect that from a keyboard that cost $20, but not one that cost $60. Don't waste your money on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, bad battery life
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has a muffled key click, which results in a quieter but less crisp typing experience. The function keys are great, including the dedicated ones for sound muting and volume controls. But where this keyboard seriously lacks is battery life. Its rechargeable battery barely lasts 7 - 10 days before needing a usb recharge via the micro USB port on the keyboard. The keyboard I had before this had alkaline batteries that used to go for months together. With this keyboard, I have to tether it to a charger. So while it is wireless in connecting to a PC, it ends up being wired to the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this model keyboard to replace the same one I loved and used daily for 5yrs. That level use wore the keys slick shortened the battery charge life. Unbelievably, this Logitech K800 keyboard of 2 MONTHS old will not charge and the light meter only shows low. It does not even work when the charger plug is in. When unboxed new I noted a few cosmetic label changes but there are hidden quality changes that wreck my confidence in Logitech. I'm using a wired backlit Logitech keyboard to type this while listening to Logitech Speakers with baseboom box but I am not at all a happy customer with the K800 keyboard that just missed the Warranty close!
customer_reviews.author: R.E.P.S.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Of all the Logitech products I've owned this is the worst. It will not hold a charge over 48 hours. Two keys on the keypad were reversed and the letter "d" intermittently sticks. I've had it two days. I bought it because my wife has used one for years and it seldom needs charging and the feel is awesome. This one missed quality control on the way to my house. Think again about buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Carson

customer_reviews.title: Issues with individual keys dying
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace one i had for years. Like size backlighting and feel and spacing when typing. This one was fine for a short while then random keys quit working. Finally a key stopped altogether. Logitech was very responsive and replaced but already starting to notice issues w various keys again. Right now the v key only works if i try it 2 or 3 times. And it randomly flashes the backlights. Unfortunate as otherwise great keyboard with white backlighting.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine D. Tarter

customer_reviews.title: Non-removable Battery life pityful
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of this keyboard for many years. When the rechargeable batteries ran low after 4 years or so I simply replaced them with a different brand for another several years of happy use. After a recent spill it was finally time to replaced the keyboard and I ordered the same model. A terrible disappointment. The batteries run out of juice every few days and the battery compartment is now sealed shut. What a silly way to destroy a perfectly good keyboard (and brand) by building in planned obsolescence. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Fields

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned after one month
customer_reviews.text: I got the Logitech keyboard about a month ago and it already started to malfunction. Uncontrolled letter typing and the it keeps popping multiple calculator screens all by itself. You just sit back and watch this keyboard go to town on its own like its possessed. Logitech is not what is used to be obviously. I had to use my old keyboard tried and true. Very disappointed. Amazon had no return option on this product either no instruction where to reference any problem. I guess you stuck with the junk. Don't say I didn't warn you.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: The worst keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard after I had read some negative reviews about it but seeing as I was not going to use it for gaming, I figured it would be ok. Pet hate for this keyboard is the way it dims the light when one just hesitates a bit during typing. This got subsequently worse the longer I used it, so much so that when I tried to use the numerical keyboard it would sometimes take 2-3 seconds to light up. in addition, it is ergonomically bad. I kept finding I was sitting off-center of the keyboard all the time. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: but I gave them another chance as I like the features of this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Logitech keyboard I've purchased. Never again. The first one had a short shelf life, but I gave them another chance as I like the features of this keyboard. Purchased in December 2017. After six months of daily but careful use (i.e. I don't pound the keys, spill coffee on it or let children use it), several keys no longer work. I do better with a $15 cheapie. At least when they stop working (which so far, the on ei Have hasn't!), I can toss it and only be out $15! I wish someone would make a quality cordless keyboard with the features that Logitech offers.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfying
customer_reviews.text: Between wireless and illuminated, this model K800 really hits the spot. Plus it feels very comfortable, just the right size, the right amount of concave-ness to the keys, just the right key press feel and response. This is my second (it was soaked, and became a science project) and my preference over all others I have looked at over the last few years. It would be nice if they were a little more coffee/wine/water proof.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Viverette

customer_reviews.title: Hate it after only two months use - this does not work with USB 3.0 device connected at same time - rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.text: I have had numerous Logitech mice and keyboards over the years. This one is by far the most expensive and has been the most trouble. The charge only last a couple of weeks. The backlight is erratic and does not always come on when it is supposed to. The worst is that the keys either do not type or type multiple letters on a single stroke. At times the keyboard just goes dead - no response to anything. After digging through Logitech's help files, found out that this does not work with USB 3.0 device connected at same time - rendering it useless for me. This defect was not noted on Amazon's web page for this device.
customer_reviews.author: MST

customer_reviews.title: The reviews don't lie
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new keyboard and my friend instantly suggested the k800. The stars aligned and with the help of camelcamelcamel I tracked it on Amazon for less than $50! I use the keyboard casually, love that it's wireless, has a thin profile and can share the same USB with the Logitech MX Master. It's got a neat feature where it detects motion to turn on and you can conserve the battery by turning it off. What were the keyboards considered? -k750 -k800 Why did I choose the k800? Almost purely superficial reasons - the illuminated keys -looks more expensive (the k750 solar panels are a bit less sleek, would probably show more fingerprints)
customer_reviews.author: Julie P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quiet Keystrokes
customer_reviews.text: Good keyboard, quiet keystrokes. Detachable power cord is nice, when another device needs power it is convenient to be able to unplug from keyboard and utilize the cord on things like my phone. Its in an office with enough light to trigger the backlighting's sensor to turn off, would have been better with a 3 way on/off/auto lighting switch. Even in normal light I like a backlit keyboard which unless I cover the sensor this is not.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit spendy, but the options for wireless keyboards that are backlit are somewhat limited. Keys feel good to type on. Has good function keys for controlling audio, video, apps etc. I like the sensor that detects when you hands get close and turn on the backlight before you press any keys. I fully charged it when I got it and after 3-4 days of use, the battery is still at full. I try to remember to power it off when I go to bed, but forgot at least one of the nights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works on a chromebook
customer_reviews.text: So far this thing is excellent. I took a chance trying this on an H/P Chromebook and to my surprise it works like a champ. System requirements claim you need windows xp or newer, but apparently it works with Chrome OS as well. I've read all the complaints of this keyboard being too fragile, which is unfortunate, but I can't speak to that as I've only used it for a couple days now. I'll update this review if and when I experience the same thing. The keys are very smooth, the back lighting is awesome, and it's very comfortable so far. The sensor for the back lighting is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R.

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless keyboard battery not replaceable
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to setup and use. Backlight motion sensor is very nice. Fast recharge and held charge a long time. However it died in 16 months of moderate use. Rechargeable battery is not replaceable without really dismantling the unit. I’m thinking about another wireless but not sure I’d buy another logitech. This was purchased from Amazon 4/18
customer_reviews.author: swineforkbeard

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one in 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these in the last year. The first lasted 7 months this second one hasn't lasted three months. They stop holding a charge and have to be left plugged into the usb (kind of defeating the purpose) and then quit all together. Very disappointed. Logitech used to be my go to for keyboards and mice, sadly no longer true.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't charge or function properly
customer_reviews.text: So far I have bought four of these keyboards. The first two are working perfectly. The next two are not working at all. They don't charge,the keyboard doesn't light up. I followed the directions on a you tube video to disassemble the keyboard and found the power plug disconnected and the keyboard connector disconnected. After plugging it all back in, it now charges and seems to work. It shouldn't be necessary to take one of these expensive keyboards aart to make it work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Functions well, ergonomics annoying
customer_reviews.text: First off, I have no criticism of the functionality of this keyboard. It completely serves the purpose of being a reliable wireless keyboard. I have two, related issues, with this product. First off it's a bit larger than I'd like. But that complaint is magnified by the clear plastic edge around the periphery of the keyboard. It's sharp and just adds extra size to an already large keyboard. I wish I could just remove the stupid, purposeless edge (it looks and feels like it's SUPPOSED to be removed). I use this as a remote keyboard on a multimedia PC. If it is used simply as a desktop, stationary keyboard the size/sharp edge probably would be inconsequential.
customer_reviews.author: A fellow named Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard BUT BE CAREFUL
customer_reviews.text: I have an IMAC with Mojave 10.14 operating system. You must go to the Logitech website/options and follow the instructions on how to get the operating system to acknowledge the keyboard. Once I did this it told me it wasn't installed etc. but my keyboard worked perfectly fine. I restarted it and everything was fine. I love the keyboard itself. This keyboard replaced a wireless SOLAR LogiTech keyboard. Never will get one of those again. I work at night and the thing was always crapping out and low power and the solar element really stunk. Finally after 3 years it just wouldn't turn on. I really hated it.
customer_reviews.author: dutchie 66

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good one
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Logitech wireless keyboards so far. On every one of them the letters start coming off in a couple of months, yes I use it a lot. Since this is illuminated the letters are embedded into the key therefore they cannot fall off. I dont use the back light but bought this simply for the fact that the letters on the keys do not come off. So far I have had this longer than any other keyboard and its great, along with the awesome Logitech functionality. No lag, no skips, flawless....Finally....
customer_reviews.author: ChrisB

customer_reviews.title: When it's Good, It's Good......but,
customer_reviews.text: If my kebaordhiworedk, i coulwrite th rreview. As you can see, this is what i wass able too to type. Keys STICK! After the first couple weeks, the keys would stick aan dnot work. Too exuasting to attempt to fix this fiasco. I swear I know how to spell and type... this is the keyboard working when it wants to work.... hmmm, looks like it is working again. Geeze. Too frustrated. Need to return!
customer_reviews.author: Super Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It's the gold standard for keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard every day for 6 months. I love the quiet, comfortable typing, rechargeable battery, and unifying receiver that lets me use a single USB dongle for both my mouse and keyboard. When other people type during conference calls, everyone hears that loud clackity clack but this keyboard makes me a stealth typing ninja. Some reviews complain that the keyboard is fragile because it starts acting up if you spill food/water on it or drop it on the floor. Yes, that's probably correct. This isn't an oldschool AT mechanical keyboard that you can beat up and abuse. This is a high tech electronic device. Treat it well and you'll do fine.
customer_reviews.author: V. Martin

customer_reviews.title: All around good wireless keyboard; Sturdy & simple.
customer_reviews.text: All around good wireless keyboard. Setup was simple. No batteries required. Charging cable appears to be made with quality, too. I use this for games and work and can't think of additional features I could possibly need. The backlight is a nice feature, too. This is the 2nd time I bought this keyboard and will do it again, if needed. I spilled a 16oz of vodka/tonic in the first one and it still worked... until most of the keys stuck together (all my fault, not the keyboard).
customer_reviews.author: William Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Dead batteries on arrival, then dead keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Batteries were completely dead upon arrival, the battery status LED just blinked red and they would not hold a charge. Turns out this is a well known issue with the K800, and is solved by replacing the batteries (at your expense) with a new set of rechargeable AA batteries. Works well now, but definitely not cool to have to spend $10 to fix a brand new $65 keyboard. Just remember to keep the old dead ones, because replacing the batteries yourself VOIDS THE WARRANTY. So by all means order yourself a dead keyboard that requires voiding the warranty to get it working. EDIT - keyboard died after 3 days even with new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Cool hand activated backlight...but batteries die quickly
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Hand-activated back-lighting of the keys Choice of several levels of the back light Quiet easy-touch keys Con: I only get a few days usage before a warning pop-up message box tells me the battery is critically low and needs to be charged. Non-lit keyboards last months (more than 12) on one set of batteries. Of course I expected some degradation with lights, but not this drastically. I'd rate Sleep Mode 5* for back light going off quickly when not actively using the keyboard, and coming back quickly when your hand nears the keyboard, but since the battery dies so quickly the sleep mode doesn't work well enough and so reduce rating.
customer_reviews.author: C3W

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this keyboard yesterday. I absolutely love it! The keys feel great with just the right amount of tactile response to let you know you are actually hitting keys. I have a Logitech wireless mouse which allows me to use the same dongle to connect them both to my PC. In other words, I need to use one less USB port. Such a nice feature if you use a lot of USB ports like me. Overall, it's just a really nice keyboard that feels great, looks great, and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Schleiffarth

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard works for 5 minutes TOPS. I've tried TWO of them!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard twice in the last 3 weeks. The first was defective, wouldn't hold a charge or work 10 minutes after I started using it. Because I like the feel of it and my daughter has had one for 2 years, I ordered a second one. It worked great for ONE DAY. Today, Day 2, it doesn't work at all. I typed for 5 minutes and it died. it came back to life briefly for 5 more minutes and now refuses to work. DON'T BUY THIS KEYBOARD!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Hoisington

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent keyboard. The sleep feature works fantastic. You don't have to touch a key just wave over it and it wakes up. The keys are easy to see with the backlight as well as in full daylight. Nice quiet keys with good feedback. You can use it while charging and it charges quickly. One dongle works both the keyboard and mouse. I am very hard on keyboards and this one is holding up well after 4 months. I use this for work, and gaming. I would say this is the best wireless backlight keyboard on the market. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Magmore

customer_reviews.title: Super typing comfort and speed.
customer_reviews.text: My old Logitech keyboard and mouse combo that I used for years finally wore out. The letters wore off and the pads on the mouse did as well (which was odd). I replaced the keyboard with the Logitech K800. It has a very comfortable key placement and feel, and is fairly quiet. It’s so nice that, literally, my typing is faster and pretty much mistake free. Something about the touch makes it so - no “miss-fired strokes”. I like the lighted keys - no painted on letters. I would prefer replacing batteries versus “plug in charging”, but I can deal with that as typing is a breeze on this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: mylittleflicka

customer_reviews.title: At the prices the Logitech Wireless cost I would not recommend this to anyone who expects a keyboard to last ...
customer_reviews.text: 1 year mfg warranty ... it died at 14 months !!! It was okay while it was working! This was the 2nd wireless keyboard I purchased for a paraplegic friend and both keyboards died at about the same age. He's now using a $20 Dell wired keyboard !!! At the prices the Logitech Wireless cost I would not recommend this to anyone who expects a keyboard to last a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the best wireless keyboard of all time..
customer_reviews.text: I'm a picky person. I'm a simple person. So when I look for wireless keyboards, I want three things: durability, responsiveness, and long battery life. This has all three in droves. The battery lasts for so long (I do turn it off at night) that I rarely find myself charging it- I charge it maybe once every month or two. I use it for general computer use and gaming. Keys are responsive. It's the perfect keyboard. My wife has two screens controlled by two keyboards and she was looking for two wireless keyboards. She tried mine and loved the quality- and so we have a total of three! All doing their job, wonderfully! All your wireless keyboard problems SOLVED!
customer_reviews.author: Paul J.J. McClellan

customer_reviews.title: it's working and love it again - second review
customer_reviews.text: okay, forget first review - i plugged one of my old phone usb things from keyboard into my ups system and voila! lights all the time - in my book 'wireless" should be WIRE LESS - like none - no batteries or any other nonsense - i'm happy! let me know when you have a light up REALLY WIRELESS keyboard and i'm in!! well, I just loved this keyboard but am most disappointed that after just about one week the keyboard no longer lights. a lot of money not to have this important feature! anyone have an idea as to how to regain the lighting feature?d please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: katydids

customer_reviews.title: A real disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked and used Logitech products, but this was a major disappointment. The Keyboard is very sensitive to contaminants. I have been successful in restoring it by using a vacuum cleaner in the past, but the most recent episode doesn’t respond. I’ve never had a keyboard that was this quirky. Customer support is almost nonexistent with long waits— they use the standard COVID excuse. Other suppliers let support work from home. The advice I have received was mostly bogus. They suggest a driver problem in spite of the fact that keyboard shows the same problem on three different computers. Recommend buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rye Gewalt

customer_reviews.title: Wanted To LIke But It Didn't Let Me
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in October 2018. Really liked the battery life, size, feel and typing ability. Now all of a sudden it went wonky on the letters. Sometimes it types in all caps and then into small. LIKe thIS. It also must keep something running to the computer because when I put my computer to sleep, it wakes right back up. PC works perfectly fine with of my backup keyboards that are wired. But this one went on the outs. Emailed logitech and waiting now to hear if they'll help me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 years - I need another!
customer_reviews.text: In a world where you can never keep up with technology, this keyboard stood the test of time! I will keep buying this keyboard until they are replaced by a brain implant. I first purchased the K800 keyboard on October 13, 2011 (off Amazon) and used it exclusively for almost 9 years! Every key still works perfect, back light works and the keyboard still looks good and feels comfortable. Heck, even after wearing down the mat finish on some keys, the key text is just as clear as the day I got it. The only problem now is the battery will not hold a charge for more than a few days. Good job Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Rockface

customer_reviews.title: Very Large Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great for night use! It is very big compared to my other Logitech wireless keyboard. There is nothing wrong with the functionality of it. If you don't want to turn a light on at night to use your laptop this is the keyboard to get. 6 months later.... several letter keys no longer work not worth the money spent on it. In the future I will not review an item until I have had it for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: anadux

customer_reviews.title: It has been over 8 years and still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best keyboards that I have owned. Has survived my young adult life and now serves as my work keyboard. This has survived being punched and stomped from me. All keys still work, the backlight has not faded, battery life has degraded but it is actually easily replaceable since it uses 2 AA rechargeable batteries. The legs have broken off though, I jerry-rig something from metal clips. It works for me. Still as satisfying to type on since the say I got it. The MX keys are a worthy upgrade though. Just no adjustable legs to angle the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kai^2

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always work as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Slow coming on and goes off way too quickly. If one pauses for more than 2 seconds the keyboard shuts down. Battery needs charging quite often. Keyboard is just slightly smaller than a full sized keyboard. Thus it can make typing a little difficult. I hit the cap lock key quite often. That's very annoying. It does, however, charge up quite quickly. Would not buy another one. I am very seriously thinking about putting the keyboard on my secondary computer! Sometimes the lights flicker and once in a while they don't even come on until you stop and restart.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Love This Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. The feel and spacing of the keys are nice, and the backlight works well in my dimly lit home office. (I have seen the backlight flicker a few times, but I'm not sure if that's a flaw or something to do with the sensor.) I use it about 4 days a week and only have to charge it about every 3-4 weeks. The low profile works well with my desk's keyboard tray, and I have noticed no issues with anything getting stuck in the keys. There is a caps lock light (on the caps lock key), but there is no number lock light -- which would be nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: kls96

customer_reviews.title: Keys like butter
customer_reviews.text: I use a few wireless keyboards, mostly Logitech, but this one is a bit nicer than most. The key press is so smooth, it's like butter. The back-lit keys are good for those days you want to game or code in darker settings. (With the lights off etc) and I like that I can control the lighting intensity. The fact that I no longer have to worry about batteries is fantastic and convenient. It's more ergo than my other keyboards, so there is a little training to get used to the placement of some of the keys and extended buttons, like arrow keys, home, insert, etc... Great product. no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: UnkulMunki

customer_reviews.title: Logitech is just another GREEDY corporation!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 800's. One, from another store, one from amazon. 1st had rechargables, the 2nd did not. No matter, neither would take a charge, ever. I tried everything. After initial charge, both never worked again. That was over $200. For a couple weeks of use. Now, battery pack is permanant. Too late to return, timewise. I feel very cheated by logitech. Seems like I am the only one in the country, to have this happen to. And I bought them a couple years apart. I am baffelled. What a waste! At my expense. Logitech is just another greedy corporation, who attains wealth, at our expense! Shame ......SHAME!!
customer_reviews.author: R0ckymtns

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same model of keyboard that finally died after five years of constant service. After I ordered it I found a YouTube video that showed how to fix the problem with the original. But I'm happy to have a spare. Had lots of keyboards on other computers and have not found a wireless backlit keyboard I like better at any price.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bigelow

customer_reviews.title: Don't get these wet!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second K800 I've bought in a month. My first one was spilled on and ruined. The one I bought to replace it was also spilled on and ruined. Some keyboards will work after you dry them out thoroughly; not these. Once they are spiiled on, they are permanently damaged. These are nice keyboards. The batteries last a long time, the keys have a nice feel and are quiet. The back-lighting is outstanding. It has most of the nice hotkey features that other keyboards have, too. The SetPoint software has come a long way, and is really handy and usable. Highly recommended, just don't get them wet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life on Keyboard, Poor Mouse Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard appears to need to be charged nearly every week. I was under the impression that the battery life would last much longer. the mouse often is choppy and doesn't smoothly traverse across the screen. I have it plugged into my desktop which sits approximately 3 feet away and still have this issue. It occurs intermittently. when the keyboard is charged it works fine and the light sensor senses my hand before i stat typing and when the mouse isn't laggy it works fine. All in all, it performed worst than lower cost options.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Rychlewski

customer_reviews.title: Love this but...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this wireless keyboard. love the quiet keys, love the way it lights up when your hand hovers over before touching it. I agree with everything the other reviewers said which is why I purchased it. One thing I didn't see anyone mention and does bother me, The Caps Lock light (the little green one that shows you it's on) is hidden somehow by the button itself. I tend to hit it a lot, and don't see that I did and I'm typing away before noticing that everything is in Caps. It's annoying so now I need to constantly check and make sure I'm not in Caps Lock. A design flaw. Other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: It was once the best......
customer_reviews.text: I have long been a huge fan of Logitech. They have been my go-to company for accessories.... until now. I have owned this keyboard for 5 years and love it, but eventually, as all things do, it started malfunctioning. I got 5 years+ use so I would have definitely given it 5 stars in the past. But I gave it 2 because the 2nd replacement in 2 weeks has died. Amazon was great about replacing the first one after it stopped working on day 4, the 2nd replacement stopped working on day 2. Apparently the quality control at Logitech has mightily slipped. Too bad, it was once the best, now it's just like the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Gmac

customer_reviews.title: Product was faulty - random keys show up - died after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst keyboard I've ever owned. It would occasionally enter keys I did not type. And eventually, after four months the darn thing wouldn't stop entering keys (the dash in this case) as if I was holding down the key which I wasn't. I could not return it because Amazon would not take it back after four months. I will not buy Logitech crap again. This was supposed to be a superior keyboard - the cost is four times what a discount brand cost. I am not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: MGar

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard with one main flaw
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these 7 years ago and it has held up well to gaming, school, and general usage but the main flaw with this keyboard is that it is impossible to take apart and put back together due to how the ribbon cable attaches and tons of glue and double sided tape. It has no way to clean it without basically destroying it, so if you end up spilling any crumbs or anything else this thing is doomed. I looked for anything of comparable quality and there seems to be little else in the same size and typing quality so I ended up with another one.
customer_reviews.author: Shadeofdeath

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect but a Sleek, Comfortable Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of it including the feel of the keys as I type. The original price of almost $100 seems too high for this keyboard and it's features but it was easier to swallow at the price I got mine for. This is the second one I buy, the other being for my boss and I have to say the quality has improved as well. As for the batteries, this keyboard has it's own builtin battery and though the battery life is short when using the back-lit keys but you can charge it by USB, otherwise, this is by far my favorite keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lozahe

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 10+ year old wired board (Microsoft). Works slick as anything. Great feel, etc. No regrets. No issues working with my Bluetooth connected mouse (Microsoft), no interference, etc. Wish there was a bit more flexibility on the configuration utility, which was clunky to use and would not allow me to select iTunes as a media player. Not happy about that, so expect Logitech and Apple are mortal enemies and don't care to cooperate so I can have the best of both worlds. Sorry. I'm growing weary of Silicon Valley Prima Donnas who can't play nice together.
customer_reviews.author: Tangent SA

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and really good feel
customer_reviews.text: Very good tactile feel and really quiet. May not be the quietest out there but I've tested multiple times with multiple people on calls and none of them said it was a problem at all. Some could not hear it at all. I use Blue Yeti mic sitting right behind the keyboard. Only con is battery life. I'm on my computer pretty much 10 hours a day. From full charge to red indicator was only about 2.5 days. Update: 10/23/2020 Been using the keyboard for a few months now and I like the keyboard but battery life sucks. I'm needing to charge it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer named Dale

customer_reviews.title: Fussy keys
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase nothing but Logitech products for my office for well more than a decade. I need like using just one USB for for my devices. But my last two Logitech purchases have been disappointing. After just one week's usage the SPACE key has gone fussy. If I don't hit it just so, I have to edit. This is an expensive keyboard, I expected far more durability than a week. I had previously purchased the 300 series baseline keyboard, it never worked. Unfortunately, i work out of the country and returns are cost prohibitive $.
customer_reviews.author: Baja Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this compact keyboard, but it started malfunctioning after 15 months.
customer_reviews.text: The keys started malfunctioning after 15 months . I asked for help and someone responded that I should take it apart and clean innards and if that didn't work, buy a new one. I bought a new one (price went up and it has been on Fed Ex truck for eons) so I could struggle with old one and then try fixing it when new one came. Fed Ex has new one still, so I bought yet another one - a cheap one, not knowing if the new one would ever come. And today, for no reason whatsoever, the keyboard started working properly again. Go figure!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Keys light up.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old one of the same type that was no longer working properly ( missing keys batteries wouldnt hold charge and lights no longer worked but after 5 years and constant daily dropping it held up well to my abuse) i do notice the lights sometimes flash but when i go to touch it the keyboard lights up and stays lit until it times out. I did hav some issues getting my unifying mouse and the new keyboard synced up but a restart and a few driver reinstalls and not using the old keyboard. I got it all synced up.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun K.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Keyboard! Full Sized!
customer_reviews.text: I never really used quality keyboard since I've always been pretty cheap about it, but during black friday, I purchased this two logitech keyboards; K800 and the MK270. The latter was super cheap, it came with a mouse, but I can definitely say I will be using the K800 as my primary keyboard. Reasons: It's full sized and even the 10 key is spaced out. The front part of the keyboard also has kind of like a wrist pad, but plastic. The keys feels much more responsive too! The product's title says it's illuminated, but that wasn't my deciding factor to purchase this, but more for ergonomics. Would I recommend this keyboard? Most definitely!
customer_reviews.author: Wilfred

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard until space bar stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of the same keyboard. The 1st one was purchased in BestBuy for myself, still working well. When choosing keyboard for my son, I decided to get the same model as I liked mine and got the 2nd one from Amazon (the one I'm typing this review with) already have been having problem with space bar for 2+ months. This one was purchased about a year ago. Will see when my 3rd one (for my daughter) starts to have issue. This seems to be a common problem with this keyboard as many reviewers mentioned about it.
customer_reviews.author: wokingfool

customer_reviews.title: Good versatile keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After over 3 years, my previous K800 keyboard back key stopped working. After using an USB keyboard for a couple of weeks, I missed my lighted keyboard and I needed another K800. Right out of the box, the new keyboard powered and paired right up with my existing USB Unifying receiver and I was back in business in less than a minute. I like that it is very convenient and simple to use this keyboard with both my laptop and desktop just by moving the Unifying receiver from one to the other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect level of illumination; all I need now is for the keys to stay attached to the keyboard and I'd be happy.
customer_reviews.text: I like the illumination, etc. I just wish the keys were a bit more firmly attached. I've had to replace any number of keys from around the keypad area/calculator is for no discernible reason. I had the same issue with previous versions as well. You'd think with the cost of this keyboard, you'd get a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A.

customer_reviews.title: Love keyboard but one big issue
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Logitech keyboard I have owned and I had been using it barely a week when the ENTER key popped off - this is the reason I had to order the 2nd one - very frustrating because you cannot use well without the enter key - between both loose enter keys and backing (one had the back the other did not) I was able to jerry-rig the key so it is workable - this keyboard is fairly expensive and I'm no gamer but do work from home - just disappointed that this has happened twice. The touch, lighting, etc., are great and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Book Buff

customer_reviews.title: 5 Years Later
customer_reviews.text: I've been running this keyboard for 5 years now. Overall, it has performed great. No issues, and still good as ever. Only a few minor annoyances... the feet collapse with pushing the keyboard forward, and the ergonomics could use a little improvement on the wrist, but it hasn't been a huge issue. I do gaming and video editing, and I've wrote tens of college papers on it too. I changed out the batteries once with new rechargeable AA's and it's like new again. The backlight is nice for the dark and I enjoy the soft noise level of the keys.
customer_reviews.author: M. Leitholt

customer_reviews.title: A good average wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It was finally time to replace my Logitech solar keyboard, so I opted to go with one that I can charge by plugging in. I tend to prefer laptop style keys, due to the shorter keypress distance and quieter sound. The keypress on this keyboard, though, was much deeper than what I was expecting. It's not bad; I would say it's between a laptop and a traditional mechanical keyboard, more towards the laptop depth. The lighting feature is great, but I did notice that sometimes it'll flicker on and off for no reason, even if I'm not near it. Battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Leffert

customer_reviews.title: Junk Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months, then the keys started sticking causing a repetition of that letter or number. Then when pressing the keys, nothing is typed on the screen. As much as I thought Logitech was a great product, this keyboard is a piece of junk! NEVER AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: LAHeat

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY DOES NOT RE-CHARGE AND NO RETURNS
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst keyboard I have ever dealt with. After very little use the "re-chargeable batteries" stopped recharging. I tried to reach out to Logitech to address this issue but they offer all kinds of support EXCEPT for these batteries. This keyboard lasted less than 6 weeks before I had to keep it plugged in ALL THE TIME to work it. I replaced it with an HP wireless keyboard that requires batteries and SWALLOWED HARD as I am totally out of the $70 dollars I spent on it since it is UNRETURNABLE!
customer_reviews.author: cparkey

customer_reviews.title: TYPES GIBBERISH AFTER ABOUT 6 MONTHS-NO SUPPORT FROM LOGITECH
customer_reviews.text: My THIRD of these -- all 3 failed within 6 months -- started typing gibberish. I changed connection dongle, didn't change behavior. I moved dongle and keyboard to 2 other computers, different places, and it is consistently typing same gibberish. The MANUALS and HELP from Logitech are horrible. After 15 years a loyal Logitech user, THIS IS THE LAST LOGITECH PRODUCT I WILL EVER BUY
customer_reviews.author: serendip

customer_reviews.title: Quietest and best functioning desktop keyboard I could find. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I tried two other keyboards before this one, but I guess third times a charm. Very quiet and excellent function. I didn't get this keyboard for a long time because of the shiny band that runs through the middle which I thought and was reviewed to be a finger print magnet. In the end it didn't even matter because I got a cover for the whole thing, which I highly recommend everyone get. At first its weird, but eventually you don't realize you're even using one. Also, pro tip, make sure you verify the model number of your keyboard matches your cover. I didn't and so it wasn't a perfect match, but anyways it gets the job done. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: May stop working at any point in time for no reason at all
customer_reviews.text: The B key stopped working after 3 1-2 months of me using it. I really like the design and feel of the keyboard tho so I bought another from best buy with a warranty oh btw logitech's customer support is so freaking terrible legit took them almost a month of responses to tell me it sounds like the item is defective and amazon should be sending me a new one for free
customer_reviews.author: Lessica

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I would really like to deduct a star for the fact that if you want to use it permanently "wired," it then takes up 2 USB ports because it will not work without the wireless transmitter. Not sure why it cant just switch to using the wire. But I really cant deduct a star because this keyboard is just great. The keys have a great feel and travel and spacing. Just perfect. The selection of brightness settings is a nice touch too.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Moya

customer_reviews.title: Illumination is sporadic
customer_reviews.text: I can set the illumination to stay on 5 minutes or even 10 minutes doesn't matter. They turn on and off sporadically. The lights stay on a matter of seconds. It's not worth returning. I like Logitech mice and keyboards, but this was a big disappointment. If I use the sensor to turn on when I touch the keyboard sometimes it'll work sometimes it wont.
customer_reviews.author: jlschrock

customer_reviews.title: $60 for a Cheap Keyboard. (AVOID AT ALL COSTS)
customer_reviews.text: Positives: + Functionality Negatives: - Price/Value - Quality (Guaranteed to break under NORMAL USE) Battery was really good for the first few months. Now it literally only lasts a couple of days. I've only had this for over a year. With less than hour usage on a daily basis. Today, one of my keys came off and I tried putting it back on but discovered that it will literally be impossible because of ridiculously bad design (Plastic piece that holds the key broke). This is supposed to be a premium product... I will never buy a Logitech product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Customer

customer_reviews.title: Illuminated & wireless
customer_reviews.text: I don't game but I do a lot of work at night with my back facing the light. Not a problem with the Logitech, the illumination is perfectly designed. I've tried other illuminated keyboards, waste of money. Another key feature, this keyboard is part of Logitech's unified system; one usb controls keyboard & wireless mouse, saving a port. I've owned 2 of these, the first for over a year before I drowned it in coffee, & its replacement for a couple of months. I recommend this product highly!
customer_reviews.author: L. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Typical Logitech Poor Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Typical Logitech. Poor quality. It worked great for the first few months then as usual with Logitech it started dropping connection. Re-pairing it fixes the problem temporarily but it re-occurs. I am either going to buy a wired keyboard or a different brand. I had the same problem with Logitech wireless trackballs until I finally gave up and purchased an El-Com which has performed flawlessly, but they don't offer backlit wireless keyboards. As for customer service, Logitech is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: DS1947

customer_reviews.title: Brand new with dead batteries and flashing red light.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased the first one had some broken keys from where a calculator fell on it...yeah the tiny snap that attaches the key face broke off. So I got a brand new one and as soon as I plugged it is the battery light was flashing red...means not able to charge. Luckily a quick google search revealed lots of people have been getting these with dead batteries...so I took the batteries out of my broken K800 and now the new one works fine. In summary these keyboards are very fragile and prone to be DOA so have some spare batteries ready.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Non-Gamer vs Gamer
customer_reviews.text: After entering professional school for Architecture at OSU I had originally purchased a Razer stealth Blackwidow Keyboard... a wonderful keyboard, especially for gaming. I lost most interest in gaming after that. Unfortunately, the Razer keyboard became defective, the "v" key would double register at times. I purchased this Logitech keyboard and I really find this keyboard wonderful. The ergonomics are excellent! I assume Logitech is known for this. I lost the charger cable at the end of the fall 2016 semester and one full charge lasted more than the entire Christmas break! This is an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard You Can Buy If You Want A Nice Typing Experience
customer_reviews.text: I just got this keyboard. The ad didn't say the key light is motion activated & stays on for 10 seconds if you don't use it. It's awesome. I need glasses now and the lighted keys are great to look at for typing. I studied the keyboard and it's of very high quality for any product nowadays. The keys have a short stroke but perfect. The keys are spaced just right & so solid they don't wobble at all. That's a cheap keyboard that does that. I love this key board. I think it will do a lot of writing and pay for it's self. I recommend this if you really want a nice typing experience.
customer_reviews.author: steveseattle

customer_reviews.title: Keys break and Stick --CAN'T FIX IT
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard worked great upon arrival, didn't last 8 months. At about 6 months in one of the keys randomly broke beyond repair thankfully it wasn't one I used super often but still annoying. Then about 9 months in the "C" key would stick Nothing would stop it I tried cleaning it several times. After about two weeks of that nonsense and I legit threw it across the room.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be Wary
customer_reviews.text: First K800 keyboard lasted exactly one day before key started sticking. Replacement K800 lasted a little over a month before the Alt key started sticking. Now it's outside the replacement window.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival.  Seems to be a battery problem with these keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Just received my keyboard and it won't work. It will not turn on and it won't charge. The charging light just blinks red continuously. Did a web search and found tons and tons of people with the same problem. Apparently, many of these keyboards ship with dead batteries. I have a support ticket into Logitech and will update this review with what I hear back. Maybe they can salvage a 3-star rating....
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Good Logitech Quality and Design
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as an exact replacement. The illuminated keys are the feature which put it over the top for me. No batteries needed. When it indicates charging needed, plug the removable cord into a USB port. It has an On/Off switch to extend the charge. Leaving it On and using it daily, I get a week from the charge. Plug the small USB receiver directly into the machine (laptop here) or use the provided extender port. If plugged into a USB hub, the keyboard won't function. As with any Logitech product, the packaging is strong and durable, guarding against shipping damage.
customer_reviews.author: Ken T

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own batteries
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a couple of these K800 keyboards and they are awesome except for one thing. The generic batteries they ship with often have a short life and don't maintain their charge. I'm not sure if that's because they are cheaply made or just that they have an expired shelf life. So add $10 to the price because that's about what it will cost you for a pack of name brand, size AA, rechargeable batteries (be sure they are labeled "rechargeable"). You'll need 2 and the battery compartment is on the bottom of the keyboard (1 small screw). This is the only reason I removed a star from my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Plutarch

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every penny. I often work in a darker room and need an illuminated keyboard. This is a great keyboard. It senses your hand movement above the keys and turns on the backlight to save the batteries which is a great feature for a wireless keyboard. I have a USB switch and it works well on both Windows 10 and Mac OS. The keyboard is also silent, no annoying keyboard click to disturb others. I've been using computers for 35+ years and this is my favorite keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Feels great; breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I've had three of these. I love the way they feel and look. However, they break really really easily. If dirt or (dog) hair causes the keys to stop working you must be extremely careful removing cleaning or plastic bits just break off. I also somehow vacuumed up a key without even touching it. I replaced my current keyboard's "c" key replaced with the numberpad "4" and the numberpad "enter' just broke for seemingly no reason. If you don't mind spending $70 on a keyboard every two years, or you are extremely clean and careful, this is a great keyboard. Otherwise, don't buy it, because it's not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Junk... keys pop off
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this the benefit of the doubt and I went ahead and ignored the bad reviews. Well, they were right. Cheap awful product. Keys pop off
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Run Away from this Trash!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has all the features I wanted except one: IT DOES NOT WORK!!! And Logitech's customer service doesn't work either. And don't get me wrong, I've owned many products from Logitech and have never had a problem, but this keyboard is simply TRASH. And it wasn't a lemon, because Amazon sent me a replacement unit when my 1st one didn't work; and the 2nd didn't work either!! Just TRASH! Run away from the Logitech K800 Wireless Illuminated Keyboard and DON'T LOOK BACK!
customer_reviews.author: RCNorm

customer_reviews.title: My Second K800 Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version K800 keyboard that has never given me a problem which takes rechargeable AA batteries on my work desktop. Love this new one with the rechargeable lion battery for my bedroom desktop. The old one didn't light up the caplock keys (symbols on upper half of the key) Also the lod one went belly up when a little bit of water got splashed on it. Killed the whole keyboard. So I bought another reliable keyboard that will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brletich

customer_reviews.title: Logitech quality control went into drain
customer_reviews.text: Construction is flimsy. Soft is glitchy. On top of it, mine came to be defective. I ended up buying exactly the same on a deal at a local BB, but only because this model fits all my needs the best, “a la cart”. But extremely upset with what became of Logitech - once the best in this peripherals and accessories market segment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and extremely quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This is what I have been looking for! It has the feel of a standard keyboard but it is "whisper" quiet. So much quieter than a regular keyboard I no longer hear myself in the early hours, or at the office. When you hear everyone typing away you will NOT be one of the ones heard any longer. It is extremely great quality and you will realize this when you recieve the perfect backed packaging and the weight of the product is substantial. Not a cheap lightweight plastic feel. I am buying another one for my home as well and going to give these as gifts for Christmas this year to co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Boot

customer_reviews.title: Constantly loses connection
customer_reviews.text: Having owned this keyboard for almost two years I can tell you that I am fed up with it. This keyboard constantly loses connection even though it is less then 6 feet away from the computer. I will be in the middle of writing a sentence and suddenly it will stop working. I am sorry I ever brought this thing.
customer_reviews.author: gljm99

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard back in 2016, and it's been a great keyboard. Battery life while unplugged didn't last super long, but I'll attribute that to having the backlight and my heavy use. I would say I used it pretty equally for both work and gaming. Looking down at it I'd say there's almost no notable wear, and if I were to clean it up I could probably pass it off as lightly used despite having used it for almost a full 4 years. I'm switching over to a mechanical keyboard for my main rig, and this keyboard will have a home at my workbench.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard, very quiet, decent action and lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this model keyboard for years. It is well made and will last several years of all day use, every day of the year before keys start to fail. It has a nice laptop type of key switch action, which is mechanical, average stroke, with a positive stop at the bottom.. It is very very quiet while typing, which is good if you type while talking on the phone, or type with others nearby. Logitech customer service is excellent and have replaced failed keyboards that were under warranty. It's pricey at $100, but I wait to buy them on sale. On the downside, it would be nicer if they lasted more than a two or three years.
customer_reviews.author: Shrock

customer_reviews.title: will have to try again
customer_reviews.text: so far this is my second defective keyboard - when Warehouse Deals are good they are great, bu there seem to be stretches where everything goes wrong, like basic product testing; the unit is very delicate, and hard to tell how bright the keyboard is since neither worked; not like there is a lot of choice out there - like the Logitech Trackball, this seems to be one of the full size back lit keyboards. and once you have one product with the unifying receiver and a lack of USB ports...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Logitech K800 Wireless Illuminated Keyboard — Backlit Keyboard, Fast-Charging, Dropout-Free 2.4GHz Connection
product_meta.description: Style:Keyboard OnlyWith laser etched, backlit keys you can see easily in any light, a sleek look, and comfortable, fluid typing, the logitech wireless illuminated keyboard k800 delivers a brilliant typing experience day or night. System Requirements: Windows XP Windows Vista Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|USB Port|Internet access required for software download.|Software required for connecting additional devices with Unifying receiver.|Software available for download here.
feature_bullets: Brightly backlit keys with illuminated characters for easy typing, even in the dark, compatible:Windows XP, Windows Vista , Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10
Perfect Stroke key system makes every keystroke more comfortable, fluid and quiet. No batteries needed: recharge quickly with the included universal micro USB cable

Easily pair with other Logitech devices through a single Unifying USB receiver. Look for orange "unifying" icon for compatible devices. NOTE: Review the videos under the image section and user manual under product details for set up and user guidance

Powerful 2.4 GHz wireless connection with one tiny Unifying receiver that stays in your computer. Works with Windows based PCs, including Windows 10 or later. Try moving the keyboard closer to the unifying receiver, or plug the unifying receiver into the receiver extender cable to bring it closer to the keyboard
Compatible with Windows XP, Windows Vista , Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10
